Uses of Interface
core.grammar.Production

Packages that use Production
core.grammar   
 

Uses of Production in core.grammar
 

Classes in core.grammar that implement Production
 class ProductionImpl
          Class that offers a concrete implementation of the interface Production.
 

Methods in core.grammar that return Production
 Production ProductionImpl.cloneProduction()
           
 Production Production.cloneProduction()
          Clone the Production returning a new one.
 Production GrammarImpl.createProduction(java.lang.String symbol, NonTerminal lnt, java.util.Collection<Element> els)
           
 Production Grammar.createProduction(java.lang.String symbol, NonTerminal lnt, java.util.Collection<Element> els)
          The method creates a new Production and adds it to the Grammar.
 Production GrammarImpl.findProduction(Production prod, int pos, NonTerminal nt)
           
 Production Grammar.findProduction(Production prod, int pos, NonTerminal nt)
          The method looks for a Production that fulfills the following properties: a) The same NonTerminal symbol at the left side, AND b) A right side with the same lenght that the right side of prod, AND c) The same Elements at the right side, with the exception of the Element at the position pos, AND d) The Element at the position pos must be equal to the NonTerminal nt.
 Production NonTerminalImpl.getLeftProd(Production p, Grammar g)
           
 Production NonTerminal.getLeftProd(Production p, Grammar g)
          Checks if the NonTerminal is at the left side of the Production with ID==p.getId().
 Production GrammarImpl.getProduction(int id)
           
 Production Grammar.getProduction(int id)
          Returns the Production object that has the id = "id", otherwise returns NULL.

 Production StochasticContextFreeGrammar.getProduction(NonTerminal nt)
          Return a Production object that has the NonTerminal symbol nt at the left side.
 Production GrammarImpl.getProduction(Production p)
           
 Production Grammar.getProduction(Production p)
          If the Production p is associated to the Grammar returns the Production object that has the ID = p.getID, otherwise returns NULL.

          Returns the Production object that has the symbol = "symbol", otherwise returns NULL.

 Production TerminalImpl.setRelation(Production p, Grammar g)
           
 Production Terminal.setRelation(Production p, Grammar g)
          If any Terminal symbol that belongs to the Production p match with the Terminal that is represented by THIS, then the method sets the right structure of the Terminal with the Production p.
 Production NonTerminalImpl.setRelation(Production p, Grammar g)
           
 Production NonTerminal.setRelation(Production p, Grammar g)
          If any NonTerminal symbol that belongs to the Production p match with the NonTerminal that is represented by THIS, then the method sets the right and left structures of the NonTerminal with the Production p.

 Production Grammar.updateProduction(java.lang.String symbol, Element e, int pos)
          The method updates a Production associated to the Grammar.

 boolean GrammarImpl.findProduction(Production p)
           
 boolean Grammar.findProduction(Production p)
          The method looks for a Production in the Grammar that fulfills the following conditions: a) There is a Production in the Grammar that has the same ID that p, OR b) There is a Production in the Grammar that has the same Symbol that p.
 Production GrammarImpl.findProduction(Production prod, int pos, NonTerminal nt)
           
 Production Grammar.findProduction(Production prod, int pos, NonTerminal nt)
          The method looks for a Production that fulfills the following properties: a) The same NonTerminal symbol at the left side, AND b) A right side with the same lenght that the right side of prod, AND c) The same Elements at the right side, with the exception of the Element at the position pos, AND d) The Element at the position pos must be equal to the NonTerminal nt.
